result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricardo M. Crawford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, requests credit for 45 days.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
** Pay DNA surcharges.  Deft to notify employer of pending charges and provide written proof to agent in writing  House arrest during the hours of darkness - not to be out 1/2 hr after sunset until 1/2 hr before dawn  or unless at work or enroute to/from work.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest.

timeConds.notes: AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION. Deft to be held pending further order of this court. Review Hearing on 7/14/15 @ 11:15 a.m.
AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION. TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  NO HUBER WILL BE ALLOWED.

supervisions.notes: Deft surrendered probation sentence.  TO COMMENCE FORTHWITH.  NO HUBER.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Diane Caspari.  Case is resolved.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  If revoked, requests credit for 45 days. Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Same appearances.  Deft appeared 45 minutes late.  Deft reports his mother was not feeling well this morning; mother is his transportation to court.  Warrant vacated.  Bond forfeiture is vacated.  Court amends deft's bond to $2500 cash bond.  Deft taken into custody.  Present cash bond to be held pending the outcome of the case.  FP set for 6/19/15 @ 9am

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Caspari appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft; case called @ 9:17am.  BW authorized; $2500 cash bond.  Prior bond forfeited.

1:35 p.m. - Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Def. appeared without counsel.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case was set for 9:00 this morning; def. failed to appear.  Def. states he thought the hearing was at 1:30 today.  Bench warrant vacated (not processed by the clerk).  Bond reinstated.  Status conf. 6/15/15 at 9:00.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty Diane Caspari appeared for defendant.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Defendant did not appear.  Bench warrant to issue with a $400.00 cash bond.  $1,500.00 cash bond ordered forfeited.
